databinning.models package

Submodules

databinning.models.ToggleSwitch module

class databinning.models.ToggleSwitch.ToggleSwitch[source]

Bases: object

Class representing the six state variable model of a Genetic Toggle Switch.

getState()[source]

Return the current state of the toggle switch.

Returns

Current state.

Return type

numpy.ndarray[float64]

initialState(init)[source]

Set the initial state of the toggle switch.

Parameters

init (numpy.ndarray[float64]) – Initial state.

make_step(u)[source]

It calculates the new state from the previous one and the value of the control input, according to the deterministic model. In the case where the noise parameter is True, the update takes into account a random noise term additive to the model.

Parameters

  • u (numpy.ndarray[float64]) – Current control input.

  • noise (bool) – If it is True it adds noise to the model.

  • step (numpy.ndarray[float64]) – Discretization step for each state.

Returns

Next state.

Return type

numpy.ndarray[float64]

class databinning.models.ToggleSwitch.ToggleSwitchSimplified[source]

Bases: databinning.models.ToggleSwitch.ToggleSwitch

Class representing the simplified model of a Genetic Toggle Switch.

make_step(u)[source]

It calculates the new state from the previous one and the value of the control input, according to the deterministic model.

Parameters

  • u (numpy.ndarray[float64]) – Current control input.

  • noise (bool) – If it is True it adds noise to the model.

  • step (numpy.ndarray[float64]) – Discretization step for each state.

Returns
